Error.description: Error is returned when a handler encounters an error. It contains a simple error message that the developer can customize.

message.description: Error message (e.g., 'user not found', 'database connection failed')

FieldViolation.description: FieldViolation describes a single validation error for a specific field.

description.description: Human-readable description of the validation violation (e.g., 'must be a valid email address', 'required field missing')

field.description: The field path that failed validation (e.g., 'user.email' for nested fields). For header validation, this will be the header name (e.g., 'X-API-Key')

GetSpaceWeatherResponse.description: GetSpaceWeatherResponse contains current space environment conditions.

ListSatellitesRequest.description: ListSatellitesRequest filters the satellite catalog query.

category.description: SatelliteCategory classifies the primary mission of an orbital object.

limit.description: Maximum number of satellites to return (default 500, max 2000).

ListSatellitesResponse.description: ListSatellitesResponse contains tracked orbital objects with propagated positions.

propagatedAt.description: Unix milliseconds at which positions were propagated.

Satellite.description: Satellite represents a tracked orbital object with propagated position.

altitudeKm.description: Altitude above WGS84 ellipsoid in kilometres.

category.description: SatelliteCategory classifies the primary mission of an orbital object.

country.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the owning country/operator.

SpaceWeatherAlert.description: SpaceWeatherAlert represents a NOAA SWPC issued alert, watch, or warning.

type.description: Alert category: geomagnetic_storm | solar_flare | radio_blackout | particle_event.

SpaceWeatherStatus.description: SpaceWeatherStatus describes the current geomagnetic and solar environment.

auroraLatNorth.description: Southernmost latitude (°N) at which aurora is visible in the northern hemisphere.

auroraLatSouth.description: Southernmost latitude (°S) at which aurora is visible in the southern hemisphere.

kpIndex.description: Kp index (0–9 scale, planetary geomagnetic activity).

kpLevel.description: Human-readable Kp level: quiet | unsettled | active | minor_storm | moderate_storm | strong_storm | severe | extreme.

ValidationError.description: ValidationError is returned when request validation fails. It contains a list of field violations describing what went wrong.

post.description: GetSpaceWeather retrieves current geomagnetic storm conditions and solar flux from NOAA SWPC.
ListSatellites retrieves tracked orbital objects with SGP4-propagated current positions.
